title: Nita Ambani hasn’t donated Gold and Silver ornaments for the construction of Ram Temple at Ayodhya
subtitle: Nita Ambani hasn't donated Gold and Silver ornaments for the construction of Ram Temple at Ayodhya. Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra trust is yet to be set up completely
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A message which claims that 111 kgs of Silver and three Gold crowns weighing 33 kgs were donated by Reliance Foundation Chairperson Nita Ambani for the construction of Ram Temple at Ayodhya is being shared on social media. Let’s analyze the authenticity of the claim.

Claim: Nita Ambani has donated Gold and Silver ornaments for the construction of Ram Temple at Ayodhya. Fact: The news that Nita Ambani has donated Gold and Silver ornaments for the construction of Ram Temple at Ayodhya is fake. The ‘Trust’ which has to foresee the construction of the temple is yet to be set up completely. So, the claim is FALSE.

When searched on Google if Nita Ambani has made any donations to the Ram Mandir that is to be constructed at Ayodhya, no information confirming it was found. Earlier, when a few posts went viral claiming about donations to Ram Mandir, ‘FACTLY’ had debunked them and those articles can be seen here and here. 



In the Ayodhya’s mandir-masjid case verdict, the Supreme Court has directed the central government to set up a trust that would foresee the construction of Ram temple at Ayodhya. Recently, PM Modi has announced in the Parliament about the setting up of a 15-member trust – ‘Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra’ for the construction of Ram temple. But, in ‘The Hindu’ article, it can be read that the trust is yet to be set up completely as few members are yet to be selected. The trust has also not solicited any funds.

To conclude, Nita Ambani hasn’t donated Gold and Silver ornaments for the construction of Ram Temple at Ayodhya.
